January 25, 2015)   Spring Semester 2015 (January 26, 2015 - May 21, 2015)   Summer Session 2014 (May 27 - September 2, 2014)     Contents       Access to Bobst Library   Access to Other Libraries for Members of the NYU Community   Access to Other NYU Libraries   Questions?          Access to Bobst Library   Library Privileges Guide   User access privileges for NYU and Consortium libraries.     Visitors requesting access to Bobst Library     • NYU faculty, matriculating students, and full-time staff with valid NYU ID have access to Bobst Library. - Faculty and Administrator Circulation Privileges - Student and Full-time Staff Circulation Privileges • Faculty and matriculating students of Consortium and Affiliated Institutions have access and borrowing privileges at Bobst Library • Faculty, students, and professional staff of SHARES member institutions , outside the metropolitan region have access privileges to Bobst Library.   • Faculty, students, and staff of Columbia University have access privileges to Bobst Library. Columbia University Reciprocal Agreement     • NYU Alumni with a valid NYU Alumni Card are entitled to one visit to Bobst Library   • Alumni and Community Members can join Friends of Bobst Library to gain access to Bobst at various membership levels     • NYU departments may sponsor access for guests, visitors, or temporary affiliates • Visiting Faculty from universities outside the metropolitan area, upon presentation of valid identification, will be granted one-day courtesy reading privileges.     • For more extended services, researchers may register in advance for a New York Public Library Access card , which enables them to use the world-class research collections at the New York Public Library .   • If a particular item is not available in either the "home" library or the public library systems, a METRO library may issue a yellow METRO Title Referral card, which will allow an individual a one-time only visit to a library to use the specified item.        A ccess to Other Libraries for Members of the NYU Community   • Consortium and Affiliated Libraries • New York Metropolitan Area libraries (METRO) • Columbia University Reciprocal Agreement • SHARES member libraries • New York Public Library - For more extended services, researchers may register in advance for a New York Public Library Access card , which enables them to use the world-class research collections at the New York Public Library. • MaRLI: Manhattan Research Library Initiative -MaRLI is available to Full-time faculty members and doctoral students from all New York University Schools and Colleges. To register for MaRLI as an NYU scholar, please go here .          Access to Other NYU Libraries     • See NYU Library Locations for contacts at other NYU Libraries, including the Courant Institute, Real Estate, Kevorkian, Fine Art, Law, Medical, Dental, and La Pietra libraries.       Questions?   Contact the Library Privileges service window during our scheduled hours at 212-998-2550, or use our Library Access Questions form to submit your question online.                      News           Earth Week Films at Bobst   Reserve a group or individual study room   Setting Google Scholar Preferences for NYU Materials   Configure your laptop for wireless!   New to NYU Libraries? New York University Libraries Friends of Bobst Library                                                                         New York University Libraries    Alumni Services                             Home   Library Access / Friends of Bobst Library   Recent Graduates   Alumni E-Library   Progressions   Giving to NYU Libraries   Contact Us                Library Access with Friends of Bobst Library  New York University alumni, neighborhood residents, and other members of the public can gain access to the Elmer Holmes Bobst Library with a 100% tax-deductible gift to Friends of Bobst Library.   Memberships help provide every NYU student the resources necessary for their academic success by expanding collections, renovating reading rooms, adding research workshops, and upgrading technology.   Sign up or renew your gift today   For same day access , visit the Library Privileges Desk, located on your left upon entering Bobst library.   Please bring a government issued photo ID. Neighborhood residents are also required to show proof of address to receive a discounted rate.   The Library Privileges Desk is open:  Monday through Thursday: 9am - 7pm  Friday: 9am - 6pm  Saturday: 10am - 5pm  Sunday: 12pm - 7pm  (Visit library.nyu.edu/hours for holiday hours)   Bobst Library is located at 70 Washington Square South, New York, NY 10012 .   Other ways to join:   • Online – Complete the online giving form . You will recieve your membership materials within two weeks. • Phone – Call the Friends of Bobst Library Coordinator, Michael Pittman, at (212) 998-2446. • Mail – Send your check, made out to "New York University" to:  Friends of Bobst Library  c/o Michael Pittman  70 Washington Square South, Room 1116  New York, NY 10012   Membership Benefits             Memberships valid through February 28, 2016       Alumni and Neighborhood Residents*       Non-Alumni           Borrower  • Borrowing Privileges at Bobst Library • Ten additional guest passes for friends and family       $1,000       $1,200           Collector • Reading Privileges at Bobst Library • Ten additional guest passes for friends and family       $500       $625           Reader • Reading Privileges at Bobst Library**       $275       $375           Scholar  • Ten visits to Bobst Library       $100       $125           Bookworm  • Three visits to Bobst Library       $35       $40             * Manhattan Community Boards 2 & 3 ** If you are part of NYU's Class of 2014, click here for your special $45 membership .   The Elmer Holmes Bobst Library offers:   • Convenient hours – Open to Friends of Bobst Library members from 7am to 1am, seven days a week*** • Onsite access to thousands of electronic resources and databases • Over 40,000 videos and 95,000 audio recordings available in the Avery Fisher Center for Music and Media • A variety of working environments, from collaborative work stations to quiet study rooms • Wireless internet access throughout the building • 175 Mac and PC computer stations • 10 floors of open stack shelving • Convenient Greenwich Village location with inspiring views of Washington Square Park In addition, all Friends of Bobst Library members will receive: • Invitations to library events including exhibition openings, receptions, and author readings • A subscription to the NYU Libraries newsletter, Progressions   To give a Friends of Bobst Library membership as a gift: Please call Friends of Bobst Library Coordinator, Michael Pittman, at (212) 998-2446.   ***Bookworm and Scholar level members must first visit the Library Privileges desk in order to receive a day pass for entry. NYU Libraries Conduct Code can be found here .               Contact Us |     NYU Libraries |       NYU Press |     NYUHome |     NYU Alumni |     NYU.edu             © 2015 New York University. All Rights Reserved.

New York University Libraries Alumni Services                                                                         New York University Libraries    Alumni Services                               Home   Library Access / Friends of Bobst Library   Recent Graduates   Alumni E-Library   Progressions   Giving to NYU Libraries   Contact Us                Library Access / Friends of Bobst Library   NYU alumni, neighborhood residents, and the general public can gain access to the Elmer Holmes Bobst Library by joining Friends of Bobst Library. more       Library Privileges for Recent Graduates   NYU's newest alumni are invited to join Friends of Bobst Library at a discounted rate to obtain reading privileges at Bobst Library for one year. more       Alumni E-Library   NYU Libraries and NYU’s Class of 2006 have provided all alumni with free, off-site access to a package of premium electronic resources, as well as continued access to RefWorks. more       NYU Libraries Newsletter - Progressions   Read about our latest acquisitions, services, and events in our biannual newsletter. more       Giving to NYU Libraries   Gifts to NYU Libraries benefit the entire University by helping us provide excellent services and materials to the NYU community. more              Contact Us |     NYU Libraries |       NYU Press |     NYUHome |     NYU Alumni |     NYU.edu             © 2015 New York University. All Rights Reserved.
